intro: Eriochilus scaber, commonly known as the rough leaved eriochilus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the plantain family, Plantaginaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in southern Australia. Eriochilus scaber is well adapted to dry conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
